 013:                              np.ndarray[DTYPEINT_t, ndim=2] GCFL_int,
 014:                              np.ndarray[DTYPE_t, ndim=2] GCFL_frac,

 019:                              DTYPE_t vxwidth,
 020:                              sim_params
 021:                              ):
 022:     """
 023:     create objects f_S and N_S that are the objects that capture
 024:     the effect of a bulk source flowing in from the right
 025: 
 026:     inputs:
 027:     S -- (ndarray, ndim=1) source function data, contains only data for vx < 0
 028:     GCFL_int -- (ndarray, ndim=2) indexed [s,j], int(CFL) for stage s at vx j
 029:     GCFL_frac -- (ndarray, ndim=2) indexed [s,j], frac(CFL) for stage s at vx j
 030:     num _stages -- (int) sim_params['splitting']['number_of_stages']['a'],
 031:                    total number of stages
 032: 
 033:     Nx  -- (int) total number of x gridpoints
 034:     Nvx -- (int) total number of vx gridpoints
 035:     sim_params -- (dict) simulation paramters
 036: 
 037:     outputs:
 038:     f_S -- (ndarray, ndim=3), shape = (stages+1, x.N, vx.N) density array that is
 039:            the contribution of the source particles to every [i,j] for
 040:            a velocity dependent distribution function
 041: 
 042:     N_S -- (ndarray, ndim = 1), shape = (stages+1,) the number of source
 043:             particles that reach the lower boundary
 044: 
 045:     see notebook s28 for details
 046:     """
